titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eugene O'Neill Papers Addition
titlestmt.author: by Michael L. Forstrom

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 04:50

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Eugene O'Neill papers addition contains correspondence, financial and legal records, and other materials relating to American playwright Eugene O'Neill and his wife Carlotta O'Neill. Correspondence consists of incoming correspondence only, chiefly to Eugene O'Neill, though there are also letters addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill jointly and to Carlotta. Correspondents include theater figures Virgil Geddes, Robert Edmond Jones, Kenneth Macgowan, and George Jean Nathan. Financial and legal records consist chiefly of financial records relating to Eugene O'Neill, such as bills and receipts and stock statements, but there are also legal records relating to O'Neill's parents, James and Ella O'Neill. Other materials include clippings, photographs, and printed ephemera.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English; some materials in French.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of McIntosh and Otis, Inc., 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Eugene O'Neill Papers Addition is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugene O'Neill Papers Addition. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Eugene O'Neill Papers (YCAL MSS 123), Eugene O'Neill Collection (YCAL MSS 124), and Agnes Bolton Collection of Eugene O'Neill (YCAL MSS 122).

bioghist.head: Eugene O'Neill (1888-1953)
bioghist.p: A biographical timeline is provided in the Eugene O'Neill Papers (YCAL MSS 123).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Eugene O'Neill Papers Addition contains correspondence, financial and legal records, and other materials relating to American playwright Eugene O'Neill and his wife Carlotta O'Neill. Correspondence consists of incoming correspondence only, chiefly to Eugene O'Neill, though there are also letters addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill jointly and to Carlotta. Correspondents include theater figures Virgil Geddes, Robert Edmond Jones, Kenneth Macgowan, and George Jean Nathan, among others. Financial and legal records consist chiefly of financial records relating to Eugene O'Neill, such as bills and receipts and stock statements, but there are also legal records relating to O'Neill's parents, James and Ella O'Neill. Other materials include clippings, photographs, printed ephemera, and a suitcase. Clippings relate chiefly to Eugene O'Neill, his father James O'Neill, and literary matters. Photographs include snapshots and studio portraits of Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Correspondence, 1927-1948. II. Financial and Legal Records, 1880-1949. III. Other Materials, 1852-1951.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name or supplied heading (in brackets).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Correspondence consists of incoming correspondence only, chiefly to Eugene O'Neill, though there are also letters addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill jointly and to Carlotta. Correspondents include theater figures Virgil Geddes, Robert Edmond Jones, Kenneth Macgowan, and George Jean Nathan, among others.
Chiefly in English, with some letters in French.

did.unittitle: American Academy of Arts and Letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II.Financial and Legal Records consists chiefly of financial records relating to Eugene O'Neill, including bills and receipts and stock statements, but there are also legal records relating to Eugene O'Neill's parents, James and Ella O'Neill.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. Other Materials contains clippings, photographs, printed ephemera, and other material. Clippings relate chiefly to Eugene O'Neill, his father James O'Neill, and literary matters. Photographs include snaphots and studio portraits of Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, financial records, printed ephemera, and other papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs by Carl Van Vechten and others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes extracts from "The Strange Interlude" (photostat) and "Notes on the Dramatic Material for a Play on Chin Shin Huang"
